strings: <se_high>Jessica: I don't know how long hunting down Dhoulmagus is going to take, but we've got to keep our spirits up.
<se_high>Jessica: That said, we can't take our sweet time about it, either.
<se_low>Yangus: I'm well chuffed that we could come down south together, guv!

<se_low>Yangus: I know a fair bit about this cont'nent, see.
I reckon I might be able to 'elp you out a bit, like.

<se_high>Jessica: Looks like we're right back where we started.
But I know how it is.
It isn't always easy to decide which way to go.
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe we should just follow the path for now?
<se_low>Yangus: If you go along the road out of 'ere for a bit, you come to this famous abbey.

<se_low>Yangus: I can't quite remember what it's called now...
Paella Abbey, maybe?
...Nah, but it was somefin' like that.

<se_high>Jessica: What are we doing in Peregrin Quay!?
I really hope you aren't thinking of going back to the northern continent already!

<se_high>Jessica: The southern continent is huge!
We should spend more time exploring it.
<se_low>Yangus: Looks like the ferry's up and runnin', eh?
<se_def>Angelo: I was sure you'd head towards Ascantha, but are you thinking of going to the northern continent!?
<se_high>Jessica: There's no way Dhoulmagus is finished with his reign of terror yet. We've got to stop him before any more lives are lost.
<se_high>Jessica: The more I learn about Dhoulmagus, the more I want his head on a platter!
<se_low>Yangus: Looks like the ferry's up and runnin', eh?
<se_def>Angelo: I used to come here from time to time, but I've very rarely gone across to the northern continent.

<se_high>Jessica: I said it before and I'll say it again.
I don't want to go back to Alexandria until we've defeated Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>Yangus: I come from this cont'nent, see, so I know the odd thing or two about the place.
<se_low>Yangus: So if ya need a navalgator, I'm yer man!

<se_high>Jessica: Hurry! I don't want to see any more victims!
We have to do something!
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't move quickly, everyone's going to get themselves killed! Abbot Francisco, Angelo, even that sarcastic Templar jerk!

<se_low>Yangus: That wise guy Angelo's gone off on 'is own.
Wonder if 'e's okay...
<se_low>Yangus: We'd better go an' check on the Abbot an' make sure Angelo's safe too. In for a penny, in for a pound an' all that!
<se_high>Jessica: Having our own ship will make our journey much easier.
<se_low>Yangus: Apart from the abbey, there's a massive town an' a little castle on this cont'nent.

<se_low>Yangus: They're both a fair old way away, mind.
We should get some shut-eye at the inn before we get goin'.
<se_def>Angelo: What are you thinking, to catch the afternoon sailing in pursuit of Dhoulmagus? You do realise it's on a set course, don't you? We can't just tell the captain which way to steer.
<se_high>Jessica: Forgive me if I'm being overly suspicious, but I hope you aren't planning on stealing one of these boats.

<se_high>Jessica: Bad idea. Look, my mum's upset enough as it is.
Let's take things one step at a time.
<se_low>Yangus: Ya can't beat travellin' by boat. The smell o' the sea air, the way it sends yer 'air all bristly...<page>Yangus: It really wakes up a man's sense of adventure!
<se_def>Angelo: If we're going to get a boat, we should get a nice fancy one, not one of these shabby little numbers here.
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: You know, we've still got unfinished business at Trodain Castle.

<se_def>Angelo: I thought old freaky-features said we should look for something in the library.
It's disrespectful not to listen to what he says,
you know.
<se_high>Jessica: Okay. We've been searching by foot, ferry, and wagon.
<se_high>Jessica: But we don't seem to be any closer to finding this elusive Moonshadow harp. Where IS it?
<se_low>Yangus: The Moonshadow 'arp, eh? Even I ain't never 'eard o' that, in all me years o' thievin'.
<se_low>Yangus: It's all very well that funny bloke sayin' it's out there somewhere, but that don't exactly 'elp us, does it!?<page>Yangus: I mean 'e coulda been a bit more spific!
<se_def>Angelo: So someone we've already met on our journey has the Moonshadow harp.
<se_def>Angelo: It sounds like it's quite a treasure, so I'd guess it probably belongs to royalty.
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to go through the tunnel in Ascantha Castle and find the thieves who stole the Moonshadow harp?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's hurry back to Trodain Castle! We've got to get back into that weird moon world!
<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'. We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.
<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv. Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.
<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character? Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.

<se_high>Jessica: Hey. We have a ship now, remember?
It's not like we can't ever come back here again.

<se_high>Jessica: In fact, we can come back whenever we like.
So why don't we hop on the ship and head west now?
<se_low>Yangus: So Dhoulmagus come from Farebury to Maella, and then on to the west over the sea.
<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv! Let's get the ship 'eaded west!
<se_def>Angelo: I heard that the world's biggest casino is over on the western continent.
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe we could just drop in there on our way? Add a bit of interest to this trailing around after Dhoulmagus.<page>Angelo: After all, all work and no play makes Angelo a dull boy.
<se_high>Jessica: You know, Peregrin Quay is the first place we went together, <hero>.
<se_high>Jessica: But there's no time for getting all sentimental about it now! Sorry!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's the plan? To come to a place wiv a good view so we can find that floatin' castle?
That ain't a bad idea, guv!

<se_def>Angelo: This really takes the biscuit!
What are we doing here at a time like this!?
Come for a pleasure boat ride, have you!?

<se_def>Angelo: If we don't stop the Lord of Darkness soon,
the world will come to an end!
Or had that slipped your mind!?
<se_high>Jessica: You know, Peregrin Quay is the first place we went together, <hero>.
<se_high>Jessica: But there's no time for getting all sentimental about it now! Sorry!

<se_low>Yangus: It's nice an' relaxin' lookin' at the sea, eh?
Even wiv a monster like 'im out there.

<se_low>Yangus: I'd never 'ave thought of comin' 'ere, mind.
In too much of an 'urry, me, like a bull at a gate! You know best though, eh, guv?

<se_def>Angelo: This really takes the biscuit!
What are we doing here at a time like this!?
Come for a pleasure boat ride, have you!?

<se_def>Angelo: If we don't stop the Lord of Darkness soon,
the world will come to an end!
Or had that slipped your mind!?
<se_high>Jessica: We don't have time to sit and chat about where the orbs might be. Let's think on our feet!
<se_low>Yangus: You plannin' on lookin' for them orbs from a place wiv a good view? That ain't a bad idea!

<se_def>Angelo: If anything strange was discovered here,
it's probably been taken to the abbey.
<se_def>Angelo: We'd be better off going there.

<se_high>Red: I used to come 'ere to this quay years ago.
The pub's pretty lively of a night. Yeah, I always 'ad a soft spot for the place, actually...

<se_high>Red: But we ain't got time for none o' that now!
If we don't see off this Rhapthorne geezer,
there'll be no more pub to come to!

<se_low>Morrie: Si, ragazzo, ships carry the people, the merchandise and sometimes the hopes and dreams to the far away places.
They are something speciale, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: So our little banda must become a ship!
We will defeat the don of the dark, and
carry the hope to all the people of the world!
